name: Simple Glazed Young Corn with Coconut Aminos and Orange Juice
description: This Young Corn in Coconut Aminos and Orange Juice recipe is a delightful twist on a healthy, low-carb, and low-sugar meal. Its unique blend of flavors satisfies the taste buds while adhering to health-conscious dietary choices. Perfect for those seeking healthy recipes without sacrificing taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the young corn in a colander or strainer. Hold it under cold running water and rinse thoroughly for about 30 seconds. Shake the colander to remove excess water and set the corn aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Take a small bowl and measure 1 tablespoon of orange juice into it. Add 1 teaspoon of coconut amino to the same bowl. Using a spoon or small whisk, mix these two ingredients together until they're fully combined. The mixture should have a uniform color.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Place a non-stick frying pan or skillet on the stove over medium heat. Allow the pan to heat up for about 1 minute. You can test if it's hot enough by holding your hand about 10 cm above the surface – you should feel the heat radiating up.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rinsed young corn to the hot pan. Carefully pour the orange juice and coconut amino mixture over the corn. Stir gently with a wooden spoon or heat-resistant spatula to coat all pieces of corn evenly with the liquid.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the corn for about 10 minutes, stirring every 2 minutes. The liquid will gradually reduce and form a light glaze on the corn. The corn is done when it's tender (you can test by piercing a piece with a fork – it should slide in easily) and has a slightly glossy appearance from the glaze.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Turn off the heat. Transfer the glazed corn to a serving dish and serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
